item.title: Best presentation award at ESM Meeting
item.description:
Margo Diricks won the "Best Presentation Award" at this year's ESM Meeting in Tirana, Albania for her presentation "Exploring the plasmidome of non-tuberculous mycobacteria".

Congratulations Margo!

item.title: Presentations at ESM Meeting Tirana
item.description:
Margo Diricks and Nils Wetzstein are presenting their newest results on plasmids and phylogenetic relations in non-tuberculous mycobacteria at this year's ESM meeting in Tirana, Alabania, 25th-28th June 2023.

They will speak about:

Margo Diricks: Exploring the plasmidome of non-tuberculous mycobacteria

Nils Wetzstein: Genomic landscape of M. avium complex in Central Germany

You can find the full program here.
We would be happy to see you there!

item.title: New publication in CMI
item.description:
We are very happy that our meta-analysis on the clinical course of heater-cooler unit associated M. chimaera infections is now finally published in Clinical Microbiology and Infection (CMI).

M. chimaera is a slow-growing non-tuberculous mycobacterium and member of the M. avium complex. It has been involved in a global outbreak of disseminated infections associated with cardiac surgery. In this review, we summarize the clinical features of 180 cases from the literature, aiming at investigating overall outcome, clinical syndrome and treatment options for those patients.

The paper can be found at ntmcope.org, the Journal's Homepage, or PubMed.

item.title: DGHM Paper of the Month
item.description:
Margo Dirick's publication "Delineating Mycobacterium abscessus population structure and transmission employing high-resolution core genome multilocus sequence typing" has won the Paper of the Month award by the German Society for Hygiene and Microbiology (DGHM). See the news announcement here.

The paper is open access and can be found at ntmcope.org, the Journal's Homepage, or PubMed.

Congratulations Margo!
